title: Accepted into Ontario Tech University
description: Got Accepted into Ontario Tech University for Honors Computer Science with Data Science Specialization for Fall 2024

title: Accepted into Seneca Polytechnic
description: Got Accepted into Seneca Polytechnic for Computer Programming for Fall 2023

title: Graduated form Seneca Polytechnic
description: After 1.5 years graduated from Seneca Polytechnic with a Diploma in Computer Programming

title: Hackathon: Ellehacks 2024
description: Created EcoGrocer, an application to address issues of overconsumption, food insecurity and inflation during the winter season.

title: Hackathon: Seneca Housing Hackathon
description: Finalist at Seneca Housing Hackathon with our project, RentEase. A web-based application designed to revolutionize the rental management system and streamline process between tenants and landloards.

title: Hackathon: GDSCHacks 2024
description: MLH: Best use of AI in Education winners, with the help our of app Note Ease. A Web application which integrates the use of Tensor Flow, google cloud speech-to-tech API and Google Gemini to help with timeless and effortless notetaking.

title: Join Seneca Student Developers Club as Scheduling Officer
description: Joined an innovative team of 8 at Seneca Student Developers Club to deliver tech related events on campus. Helped with Scheduling SCRUMS and using availability details to ensuring efficient arrangment of meetings as well as MOnitoring Sprint & kanban board to ensure completion of tasks.

title: Attended Techspo Toronto 2024
description: Attended the Techspo with my friends from Seneca Polytechnic where we learned about prominent tech topics in regards to blockchain and AI.

title: Joined Women in Computer Programming as Treasurer
description: As a women in tech, I've noticed the gender gap between our programming classes was large and decided to promote a positive envirnoment on campus to allow other women to collaborate and provide support to close the gender gap

title: Started my Journey at Ontario Tech University
description: Excited to embark on this journey at Ontario Tech University while finishing my last semester at Seneca Polytechnic

title: Attended 2024 CAN-WIC Conference
description: Had an amazing oppertunity to attend CAN-WIC Conference with fellow CS classmates from Ontario Tech University, where we had the oppertunity to network with other women in stem.

title: Tech Cadets
description: Embarked on a new journey with Tech Cadets to help gain more project building experience and collaborate with other fellow tech cadets.

title: Rewriting the Code
description: Had an amazing oppertunity to join a community of 30,000 fellow women in stem across the world through rewriting the code's online community. Looking forward to attending many of these events and connecting with other fellow women in stem.

title: Hackathon: CRTL+HACK+DEL
description: Attended CRTL+HACK+DEL at york university, where in a team of 4 talented programmers learned how to use React and submit a project. Although our team was pretty new towards hackathons we're able to trouble shoot through git merge conflicts and bugs and had lots of fun!

title: Joined Ontario Tech ACM-W Student Chapter as Vice-Chair
description: Joined a group of talented dedicated women in stem to help foster an inclusive and supportive envirnonment at Ontario Tech University. We'll be planning networking events, mentorship programs, technical workshops and career development oppertunities. Looking forward to the start of an amazing year!

title: Hackathon: DeltaHacks XI
description: Participated in DeltaHacks XI at McMaster University with my friend, Gurmehak, where we created NoMore404 using Streamlit (a python based web development tool) and Cohere.

title: Hackathon: Ellehacks 2025
description: Participated in Ellehacks 2025 at York University with my friend, Francesca. We had the oppertunity to tackle a health related prompt and created Hack Attack. Hack Attack is an interactive game created with mediapipe to help promote healthy fitness during winter months.

title: Hackathon: GenAI
description: Decided to go into GenAI at University of Toronto, without a team and no preparation whatsoever. It turns out that hackathons indeed can still be fun and exciting as it gives you the oppertunity to meet new people. I've met some close tech friends Kelvin, Kevin, and Ali through this expereince where we created FocusFlow

title: CSCI 1062: Syntax Sisters
description: A semester long project with chaos and creativity. With a team of 6 we've formed our group syntax sisters were we created an interactive calendar using flet to provide companies with a solution to their task management needs.

title: Hackathon: GDSCHacks 2025
description: Yet another hackathon where we created FinanceCats a spin off the modern day idea of Finance bros. Why take advice on finance from cats? With a team of 3 we've conquered this hackathon and networking with other hackers.

title: IBM TechXChange Java App Modernization
description: Just had an amazing opportunity to attend an IBM TechXchange 2025 workshop, Fast Track Java App Modernization with GenAI, where I got to explore IBM Liberty and the JSphere Suiteâ€”game-changing tools for Java modernization!

title: Hackathon: Perplexity AI
description: A month long hackathon with a friend? Although the month was long and tiring we've made it work. Together we created a platform to help connect vc firms and startups together called StartupConnect.

title: RTC: Summer Hub Series Welcome Event 2025
description: Along side 30,000 women across the global the toronto rtc community hosted their summer hub series welcome event, where we all gathered for an evening of netowrking, fun and games.

title: IBM TechXChange Java Users Group on LLMs
description: IBM TechXChange and the Toronto Java Users Group had a collaboration where they've thought various topics in regards to using simple LLM's in applications to LnagGraph4J and how to use them effectively in Applications.

title: The Founders Journey Certificate
description: Recieved a certificate from the Morrissette Entrepreneurship at Western University. Where they provided an interactive and truely inspirational course on the entrepreneurial process and what goes behind the sceens of a startup.

title: Meta Introduction to Mobile Development
description: I've gotten a new certificate from Meta for Introduction to Mobile Development, where I've learned from the basic HTML, CSS, Javascript to using react.js!

title: Meta Version Control
description: I've gotten a new certificate from Meta for Version Control where I learned how to navigate through team building projects and using github to manage collaborative programming experiences effectively.

title: Meta Programming with JavaScript
description: Yet another certificate from Meta for Programming with Javascript. Although I had previous experience with Javascript this course help me to enhance my experience knowledge and learn about the history of javascript and how it shifts to different frameworks.

title: RTC: Networking Event @ Sentry HQ Toronto
description: Had an incredible oppertunity to attend a networking event at Sentry HQ Toronto. I've met some incredible people and learned about the different opportunities that are available to me.

title: Hackathon: SpurHacks
description: Waterloo?? SpurHacks?? 30 hours?? I had the incredible Oppertunity to attend SpurHacks as one of the startup stream participants, coding and planning out our business aspects of our startup.

title: Got Chair Position for Ontario Tech ACM-W Student Chapter
description: Have the incredible oppertunity to become chair of ACM-W at University of Ontario Tech. This is a personal huge milestone of mine as I'm usually an introverted person. With this new found oppertunity I plan to help close the gender gap in the tech industry.
